posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.43 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

★ Mainly background work, hopefully improved networking experiences

Complete list of new commits since 7.42.2:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.42.2…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Signal Beta Crashing when try to post stories

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.43.0 (154600)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

25 new commits since 7.42.2:

Show commits

  • Update test client prekey usage to include kyber keys. [1]

  • Add UI for when the user's grace period expires or while they are in the grace period. [2]

  • Fix alignment of progress spinner when waiting for network.: [3]

  • Add cancellation support and renew support for canceled subscriptions. [4]

  • Ensure all billing states are emitted. [5]

  • Backups ui polish. [6]

  • Change button size on backups management screen. [7]

  • Fix country code filtering by removing "+" prefix handling. [8]

    Closes #14137

  • Attempt to fix duplicate e164s due to short codes. [9]

  • Force new auth WebSocket during various IMO recovery flows. [10]

  • Add support for cancelling an in-progress archive upload. [11]

  • Allow free tier subscription if Google Play Billing is not available. [12]

  • Fix scrolling highlight on backups checkout page. [13]

  • Prevent safety number changes during quick restore flow. [14]

  • Fixed color of Get started text. [15]

  • Fix ability to remove link preview without changing message text. [16]

  • Bump to libsignal v0.73.0 [17]

  • Cancel chatConnectionFuture when we get disconnect() while CONNECTING. [18]

  • Remove unused CdsiSocket class. [19]

  • Default remote backups to daily. [20]

  • Fix decryption errors post remote restore. [21]

  • Rotate key for libsignalWebSocket RemoteConfig. [22]

  • Ensure default chat folder exists. [23]

  • Update translations and other static files. [24]

  • Bump version to 7.43.0 [25]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.42.2…v7.43.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked:
Hello!

Signal crash at launch everytime after I was able to open it first post update :

error "exception in method call 'complete': exception java.lang.NoSuchMethodError "no non-static method "Lorg/signal/libsignal/internal/CompletableFuture;.complete(Ljava/lang/Object;)Z""": exception in method call 'completeExceptionally': exception java.lang.NoSuchMethodError "no non-static method "Lorg/signal/libsignal/internal/CompletableFuture;.completeExceptionally(Ljava/lang/Throwable;)Z""
05-21 17:44:49.338 12599 12628 I libsignal: rust/net/src/connect_state.rs:356: [authenticated] connection through chat.signal.org:443 (direct) succeeded after 1.110s
05-21 17:44:49.340 12599 12628 I libsignal: rust/bridge/shared/types/src/net/chat.rs:330: successfully connected authenticated chat
05-21 17:44:49.343 12599 12628 E libsignal: rust/bridge/shared/types/src/jni/futures.rs:157: failed to complete Future with error "exception in method call 'complete': exception java.lang.NoSuchMethodError "no non-static method "Lorg/signal/libsignal/internal/CompletableFuture;.complete(Ljava/lang/Object;)Z""": exception in method call 'completeExceptionally': exception java.lang.NoSuchMethodError "no non-static method "Lorg/signal/libsignal/internal/CompletableFuture;.completeExceptionally(Ljava/lang/Throwable;)Z""
05-21 17:44:49.354 12599 12628 I libsignal: rust/net/src/connect_state.rs:356: [authenticated] connection through chat.signal.org:443 (direct) succeeded after 1.102s
05-21 17:44:49.355 12599 12628 I libsignal: rust/bridge/shared/types/src/net/chat.rs:330: successfully connected authenticated chat
05-21 17:44:49.357 12599 12628 E libsignal: rust/bridge/shared/types/src/jni/futures.rs:157: failed to complete Future with error "exception in method call 'complete': exception java.lang.NoSuchMethodError "no non-static method "Lorg/signal/libsignal/internal/CompletableFuture;.complete(Ljava/lang/Object;)Z""": exception in method call 'completeExceptionally': exception java.lang.NoSuchMethodError "no non-static method "Lorg/signal/libsignal/internal/CompletableFuture;.completeExceptionally(Ljava/lang/Throwable;)Z""
05-21 17:44:49.462 12599 12628 I libsignal: rust/net/infra/src/route/connect/logging.rs:94: [authenticated 2] TCP failed after 922.974碌s: Failed to establish TCP connection to any of the IPs
05-21 17:44:49.796 12599 12628 I libsignal: rust/net/src/connect_state.rs:356: [authenticated] connection through chat.signal.org:443 (direct) succeeded after 1.147s
05-21 17:44:49.797 12599 12628 I libsignal: rust/bridge/shared/types/src/net/chat.rs:330: successfully connected authenticated chat
05-21 17:44:49.802 12599 12628 E libsignal: rust/bridge/shared/types/src/jni/futures.rs:157: failed to complete Future with error "exception in method call 'complete': exception java.lang.NoSuchMethodError "no non-static method "Lorg/signal/libsignal/internal/CompletableFuture;.complete(Ljava/lang/Object;)Z""": exception in method call 'completeExceptionally': exception java.lang.NoSuchMethodError "no non-static method "Lorg/signal/libsignal/internal/CompletableFuture;.completeExceptionally(Ljava/lang/Throwable;)Z""
05-21 17:44:50.146 12599 12612 I org.thoughtcrime.securesms: Background concurrent mark compact GC freed 30MB AllocSpace bytes, 47(2268KB) LOS objects, 75% free, 14MB/58MB, paused 3.617ms,5.804ms total 368.698ms
05-21 17:44:50.604 12599 12628 I JobManager: Successfully flushed.
05-21 17:44:50.613 12599 12653 I Process : Sending signal. PID: 12599 SIG: 9
Same here, crash every time it launches. Will get log when I get home.

Same here

Summary

We’re releasing the Signal 7.43 beta

Sorry about that - actively looking into it and should hopefully have something out soon for you all. Switched the latest release to be 7.42.2 so hopefully Obtainium will adjust accordingly.

posts.name: SignalUser
posts.cooked:
Same here…

Obtanium is now trying to install an older version. However, this is rejected with an error message.

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked: I wasn’t having any crashing issues until I tried to share a link to a Signal chat. Now the app crashes and won’t open.

  • Update translations and other static files. [2]

posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked: Those on 7.43, could you try updating to 7.43.1 and see if that fixes things?

mtang-signal:

see if that fixes things?

Yes, it’s fixed. Thanks for the quick update.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: worked like a charm! thanks for the quick fix (didn’t even have enough time to report it lol)
Haha same here, .1 arrived before I even got home so no logs are needed

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked: Fixed! Thank you for the quick fixes

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked:
Backup stuck at 14% until I opened the Chats/Backups screen

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.43.1/4d4fdf276a5fa329966b693b96fdc8ff2bb36fd6c7c3666c8350fe6bff82132b

Again draining the battery and warming up my phone.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Huge delays on Pixel :(

1748077087654

Happening very consistently amongst all Pixel devices that I know.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.43.1/cade23d0a994b31ceecea8af59510a81b1af03b7820b8216960c8972fa5e8db3

What can I do? Signal is mission critical for a lot of my activities :(

I ended up enabling websocket on someones Pixel 7 on stock because messages were delaying up to 30 minutes some times.

1748076900115 ← This one, also in the logs took nearly 20 minutes to arrive on my Pixel 8 Pro :(

It feels as though my linked desktop and iPad are delaying my messages. I know there’s a system in place to prevent additional notifications and server has a lot of recent changes. I’d been ignoring the issue for a while in case it was a temporary thing, but it’s getting quite bad.
No delays here one a Pixel 7, Pixel 7a and Pixel 8 Pro, with linked desktop and Molly on Android Tablets.

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked:
Whatnoww:

What can I do? Signal is mission critical for a lot of my activities :(

As a very long time beta tester (since textsecure) i ended up discontinuing my beta usage because of the inherent instability of beta software coupled with the fact that I started using it in an org where I depend on it daily. You might need to go the same direction.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: alternatively, have two connected devices, one stable and one beta.
